properties.name: graphql.servlet.security.enabled
properties.description: It defines if the GraphQL Servlet default path will be secured or not. Useful for development environments, which we can use Voyager to show the GraphQL Schema without authentication.

properties.name: spring.web.client.rest-template.decorate-with-auth-header
properties.description: If a default RESTful API client was created, we can decorate the requests made by it with the authentication header.

properties.name: spring.web.security.default.authentication.enabled
properties.description: It defines if the default Authentication will be enabled or not.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.enabled
properties.description: It defines if JWT Authentication will be enabled or not. Process of retrieving the user/password from the Request Body and verifying if the password matches. Here we will obtain all roles configured for the user.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.authorities.parameter
properties.description: It defines the parameter name that will be used to extract the authorities for the JWT Token.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.authorities.parameter-administrator
properties.description: It defines the parameter name that will be used to extract the information if a JWT Token was generated for an administrator user.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.login-url
properties.description: Sets the URL that determines if authentication is required.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.expiration-period
properties.description: The period of time in which the JWT token expires or terminates in hours (-1 means no expiration).

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.encryption-method
properties.description: It defines the encryption method to be used to encrypt/decrypt the JWT Token. Possible values: asymmetric, symmetric.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.cors.allowed-methods
properties.description: Set the HTTP methods to allow, e.g. GET, POST, etc. The special value '*' allows all methods.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.cors.allowed-headers
properties.description: Set the list of headers that a preflight request can list as allowed for use during an actual request. The special value '*', may be used to allow all headers. By default all headers are allowed.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.cors.allowed-origins
properties.description: The list of allowed origins that be specific origins, e.g. 'https://domain1.com', or '*' for all origins. By default, all origins are allowed.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.cors.exposed-headers
properties.description: Set the list of response headers other than 'simple', headers, i.e. Cache-Control, Content-Language, Content-Type, Expires, Last-Modified, or Pragma, that an actual response might have and can be exposed. Note that '*' is not supported on this property.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.delegation.enabled
properties.description: It defines if JWT Authentication Delegation will be enabled or not. Process of retrieving the user/password from the Request Body and verifying if the password matches is delegated to another API.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.delegation.base-path
properties.description: It defines the base path for the JWT Authentication Delegation API.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authentication.delegation.login-url
properties.description: Sets the URL that determines if authentication is required for the JWT Authentication Delegation API.

properties.name: spring.web.security.jwt.authorization.enabled
properties.description: It defines if JWT Authorization will be enabled or not.

properties.name: spring.web.security.sign-request.authorization.enabled
properties.description: It defines if Sign Request Authorization will be enabled or not.

properties.name: spring.web.security.sign-request.authorization.client.id
properties.description: Defines the client id.

properties.name: spring.web.security.sign-request.authorization.client.secret-key
properties.description: Defines the secret key associated with the client id, which will be used to sign the request.
